citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: A Map of the Provinces of Delhi, Agrah, Oude, and Ellahabad Comprehending the Countries Lying Between Delhi and the Bengal-provinces, 1794

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the 1794 paper map entitled: A Map of the Provinces of Delhi, Agrah, Oude, and Ellahabad Comprehending the Countries Lying Between Delhi and the Bengal-provinces. The map is in two sheets both were scanned at 300 dots per inch and are in the TIFF format.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. These images may be used in a GIS; the datasets include a .txt file containing a table of coordinates that may be used to aid in georeferencing the image.
descript.supplinf:
1 map on 4 sheets : hand col., dissected and mounted on linen ; 107 x 106 cm., sheets 56 x 55 cm.
Scale [ca. 1:730,000]
Map of the northern provinces of India showing roads, district and provincial boundaries./ Relief shown pictorially./ "Published 12th May, 1794".
surveyed by Major James Rennell, Surveyor-General to the Honourable East-India Company, and published by order of the Court of Directors of the said company by Andrew Dury ; Willm. Haydon, sculpt.

theme.themekey: Uttar Pradesh (India) -- Maps -- Early works to 1800

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

idinfo.datacred: Thanks to Prof. Frances Pritchett, Columbia University, for providing the original paper map for this scan.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.
